posts:
I am currently doing this by splitting the strings first by ; and then by =.

In PHP I can use the following preg_match pattern to do this in a single step without iteration. Is it possible to do this in Lua?

preg_match_all("/(?:([a-z]+)=([0-9.]+)(?:;|$))/", $a, $match, PREG_SET_ORDER);
" OwnerUserId="465590" LastActivityDate="2015-03-05T10:07:55.763" Title="Lua split string into 2d array in single step" Tags="" AnswerCount="1" CommentCount="0"/>

Replace by:http://Example.com/$1

See demo.

https://regex101.com/r/eS7gD7/13

Properties File Path:

/tmp/env.properties

File content:

TEST_STACKOVERFLOW = "my_value"

Build step:

echo $TEST_STACKOVERFLOW

Result:

[workspace] $ /bin/sh -xe /tmp/hudson8256628035734643761.sh
+ echo '"my_value"'
"my_value

Tags="" AnswerCount="0" CommentCount="1"/> " OwnerUserId="4363119" LastActivityDate="2015-03-05T09:25:06.703" CommentCount="2"/>

I want to construct a query for the following scenario. I have to find the documents for field in particular range.

field1:200-400 field2:300-400 so the above 2 documents should come.

My query is as follows:

"query": {
    "bool": {
      "must": [
        {
          "range": {
            "field1": {
              "gte": 200,
              "lte": 400
            }
          },"range": {
            "field2": {
              "gte": 300,
              "lte": 400
            }
          }
        }
      ]
    }
  }

But the above query "Looks for 2 fields in a singe document, so no result is coming. SO i have to make to search if any of the filed satisfies the range in the document should return. Please share your ideas. Thanks in advance.

" OwnerUserId="1817416" LastEditorUserId="1817416" LastEditDate="2015-03-05T10:01:27.883" LastActivityDate="2015-03-05T10:23:37.363" Title="Elastic search range query" Tags="" AnswerCount="1" CommentCount="0"/>
